subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] A new hack?
author: Marlboro63@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1206983811
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Frank,
 
That is awesome that you can make a sweep unit for the radio shack  hack 469 
unit.  When you are done is there a chance that you will be  posting the 
schematics so that we can follow on it and make one for  ourselves?
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 3/31/2008 1:51:49 A.M. Central Daylight Time,  
purplealiengirl@... writes:

 
 
 
I mounted the '469 guts on a board, and added a 3 volt regulator to  run the 
RS radio off the 12 volt supply. I have the sweep working so far,  hopefully 
tomorrow I can test the radio with external sweep to see if it  actually works. 
The frequency display is now useless, so it's face down, and  the power and 
band buttons will be added to a new front panel. I'm not sure if  I want to 
make this direct out, or make it just like any other box. The audio  should be 
more better than anything I've done so for, at least it sounded real  good when 
I was using a manual control, but only could tune half the AM or FM  bands 
wihtout the negative tuning voltage component. 

The  radio playing in the background is just C2C on a regular radio.  

Frank-S
